wizards.subTitle: Use your self-owned domain as the endpoint of your Appwrite API.

texts.chooseWebhook: Choose any name that will help you distinguish between Webhooks.

texts.stepOne: Use webhooks to build integrations that subscribe to specific events on Appwrite. Appwrite will send an HTTP POST payload to the webhook's configured URL when one of the specified events is triggered.
texts.events: Set the events that will trigger your function. Maximum 100 events allowed.
texts.addEvent: Add an event to get started
texts.selectEvent: Select events in your Appwrite project that will trigger your webhook.
texts.untrustedCertificate: Untrusted or self-signed certificates may not be secure.
texts.security: Set an optional basic HTTP authentication username and password to protect your endpoint from unauthorized access.
texts.secureEndpoints: Use to secure your endpoint from untrusted sources.

androidPlatformKey.label: Package Name
androidPlatformKey.tooltip: Your package name is generally the applicationId in your app-level build.gradle file.

appleHostname.label: Bundle ID
appleHostname.tooltip: You can find your Bundle Identifier in the General tab for your app's primary target in Xcode.

webHostName.label: Hostname
webHostName.tooltip: The hostname that your website will use to interact with the Appwrite APIs in production or development environments. No protocol or port number required.

texts.initSdk: Now that you've downloaded the SDK, it's time to initialze it. Use your project ID, which can be found in your project settings page.
texts.apiCall: Before sending any API calls to your new Appwrite project, make sure your device or emulator has network access to your Appwrite project's hostname or IP address.
texts.alert: When connecting to a locally hosted Appwrite project from an emulator or a mobile device, you should use the private IP of the device running your Appwrite project as the hostname of the endpoint instead of localhost. You can also use a service like ngrok to proxy the Appwrite server.

extensions.placeholder: Allowed file extensions (mp4, jpg, pdf, etc.)

texts.setMaxBucketSize: Set the maximum file size allowed in the bucket.
texts.enableFileSecurity: When file security is enabled, users will be able to access files for which they have been granted
texts.fileDisabled: If file security is disabled, users can access files
texts.onlyBucketPermission: only if they have Bucket permissions
texts.enableDisableSecurityService: Enable or disable security services for the bucket including
texts.configureEncruption: This parameter allows you to configure whether or not the files inside the bucket will be encrypted. We don't encrypt files bigger than 20MB.
texts.configureAntivirus: This parameter allows you to configure whether or not the files inside the bucket should be scanned by the Appwrite Antivirus scanner.
texts.chooseCompressionAlgo: Choose an algorithm for compression. For files larger than 20MB, compression will be skipped even if it's enabled.
texts.allowedFileExtensions: Allowed file extensions. A maximum of 100 file extensions can be added. Leave blank to allow all file types.

security.passwordDictionary: Enabling this option prevent users from setting insecure passwords by comparing the user's password with the

passwordHistory.phraseTwo: Set the maximum number of passwords saved per user. Maximum 20 passwords.

security.sessionLength: If you reduce the limit, users who are currently logged in will be logged out of the application.
security.sessionLimit: Maximum number of active sessions allowed per user.
security.usersLimit: Limit new users from signing up for your project, regardless of authentication method. You scan still create users and team memberships from your Appwrite console.

overview.sdks: Our SDK's make it possible to easily add any platform that you want to use.
overview.addPlatform: Add a Platform to View Data About Your Project
overview.insights: Get insights on bandwidth usage, requests, realtime connections and more after making your first API call
overview.scopePermission: Choose which permission scopes to grant your application. It is best practice to allow only the permissions you need to meet your project goals.
overview.deletePermanent: The API Key will be permanently deleted. This action is irreversible.
overview.chooseName: Choose any name that will help you distinguish between API keys.
overview.permissionScope: You can choose which permission scope to grant your application. It is a best practice to allow only the permissions you need to meet your project goals.
overview.congratulations: Congrats, you've just added your first platform to your Appwrite dashboard! Are you ready to give it a go? Why not add a database to your project, or start uploading files? The choice is up to you.

functions.timeLimit: Limit the execution time of your function. Maximum value is 900 seconds (15 minutes).

functions.noExecutionLogs: You have no execution logs. Create and activate a deployment to see it here.
